column4: Greetings and Merry Christmas all! Question= Is there anything that plays midi music embedded in web pages for Ubuntu?
what a horrible horrible thing to ask.. ... ... you should be ashamed of yourself.. ... but yes.. I think there is
slart maybe but I'm new to ubuntu
I think there is some kind of plugin... can't remember the name.. but it makes all those..*shudder* old pages with midi background music work =)
midi music on webpages is just as bad on windows as it is on ubuntu =)
slart thanks. Some of us old farts still use midi.
oh.. don't get me wrong.. the midi format is good.. I just hate web pages that insist on playing music
you'll probably want to use timidity for playing midi's on ubuntu
slart me too, that's why I create them. Annoyance brings attention. lol
ah.. there you are, world.. look at that link from ubotu
OK I have TiMidity++ and it plays excilent on comand, however when I open a webpage with midi embedded it does not play.
perhaps this one will help.. it's not the one I remember.. but it says it will play IE only bgsound midis https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/1765
